Claim: "This person looks to be snowboarding on a very small pile of snow."
Implication: "Young snowboarders are sizing up their next jump."
Referring expressions: This person, snowboarding, small pile of snow.  You, young snowboarders, next jump.
Formula: (exists c (exists a (IsSnowboarding(a) and IsOnSmallPileOfSnow(c))) & (forall h (forall g ( IsSnowboarding(g) ->   IsYoungSnowboarder(h)))) & (forall i (forall j (  IsYoungSnowboarder(i) ->  IsSnowboarding(j))))) -> (exists f (exists e (exists d (IsYou(d) and IsYoungSnowboarder(e) and IsSizingUp(f)))))
